nodes.bodyText: Could this class be directly be used without subclassing? Then we should remove abstract.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,92 @@

+package org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.partition;
+
+import org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.api.writer.ResultPartitionWriter;
+import org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.buffer.BufferBuilder;
+import org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.buffer.BufferConsumer;
+import org.apache.flink.util.TestLogger;
+
+import javax.annotation.Nullable;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
+
+/**
+ * Basic behaviours of {@link ResultPartitionWriter} for test purpose.
+ */
+public abstract class ResultPartitionWriterTestBase extends TestLogger implements ResultPartitionWriter {

nodes.bodyText: Good catch. My previous assumption was to only implement partial basic common methods, but after refactoring I actually implement all. So the abstract is really redundant now, i will remove it.

nodes.bodyText: Further I propose to change the name to MockResultPartitionWriter. I think the suffix TestBase is mostly used for unit tests.

nodes.bodyText: Finally, there is no benefit by implementing TestLogger since subclasses will not be used for implementing test cases.
